image.altText: Frank Pangallo at a political announcement.

props.synopsis: High-profile SA Liberal recruit Frank Pangallo admits he sought advice about becoming deputy leader of the party, despite the incumbent in that role saying the position is not vacant.

title.children: Pangallo eyed deputy's job as Liberal MPs back Ashton Hurn

image.altText: A group of young people toast over a meal holding glasses of limoncello.

props.synopsis: South Australian distillers are tapping into a growing global thirst for limoncello and finding a new market for lemons and grape spirit.

title.children: The sweet spirit 'steeped in tradition' that's becoming trendy

image.altText: A close up historic shot of a man wearing aviator sunglasses.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Bevan Spencer von Einem — who police have linked to "The Family" — has died while serving a life sentence for the sexually motivated abduction and murder of Richard Kelvin in 1983.

title.children: Notorious murderer Bevan von Einem dies while serving life sentence

image.altText: A man in a dark dry suit floating with his head above water in a pool, in scuba diving gear.

props.synopsis: Open water divers say underwater visibility has improved and marine life is returning to some areas off South Australia's coast. Experts say it's a positive sign, but warn it's "way too early" to say the environment is recovering from the state's algal bloom.

title.children: Fish returning to some parts of SA's coast, divers say

image.altText: A wine industry expert stands amid vines.

props.synopsis: Among the main factors contributing to women leaving Australia's wine industry were sexism, discrimination, and a lack of flexibility, a nationwide study has found.

title.children: Sexism, harassment and inflexibility drive women out of winemaking

image.altText: Laneway before a single storey building

props.synopsis: Residents of Gilbert Street who originally opposed a development proposal say a deal was struck behind closed doors to proceed with planning.

title.children: Adelaide residents 'in the dark' over Gilbert Street development proposal

image.altText: Queen Elizabeth Hospital new clinical services building.

props.synopsis: A 36-year-old who prompted a manhunt after allegedly escaping custody at Adelaide's Queen Elizabeth Hospital on Thursday night has been re-arrested and will face court on Monday, police say.

title.children: Alleged Adelaide hospital escapee re-arrested after manhunt, police say

image.altText: A picture of an English teenage cricket fan smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Tommy Lamb is taking the long way from Manchester to Adelaide for the third Ashes Test and the 18-year is closing in on a 100-day odyssey that must be seen to be believed.

title.children: The 100 days, 21 countries and one fractured skull behind one Pom's wild Ashes tour

image.altText: Three young girls, with the middle one carrying a toddler.

props.synopsis: The stark beauty of Australia's protected APY Lands is alive with ancient songlines and culture. But Elders see a need for change to secure the future of today's children.

title.children: Rare look at family, country and culture on the beautiful APY Lands

image.altText: Charlotte Walker

props.synopsis: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.

title.children: Australia's youngest senator was catfished on social media as a teen

image.altText: A groundsman crouches down to touch the pitch on a cricket ground, as he holds a tool used to flatten pitches.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide-Hobart WBBL match has to be abandoned after a ball goes under the roller during the innings break, creating a hole in the pitch.

title.children: Hole in Adelaide pitch complicates WBBL finals puzzle

image.altText: Wayne Klingberg's white Hyundai Terracan flipped on its roof with broken windows

props.synopsis: A driver accused of killing a passenger in a car rollover captured by his own dash cam has been found not guilty of causing the death, but guilty of aggravated driving without due care.

title.children: Verdict delivered for man accused of killing passenger in car rollover

image.altText: An artist's projection of the Hydrostor facility near Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

title.children: Compressed air energy storage is coming, but how does it work?

image.altText: The outside of a court building in a CBD.

props.synopsis: Three lawyers will face Australian legal regulators, with one ordered to pay $10,000 in costs, after submitting a legal document prepared with artificial intelligence and found to contain "inaccurate and misleading references".

title.children: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used for court document

image.altText: A woman holds up a glass container with small fishes inside, her face seen through the glass and water

props.synopsis: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

title.children: Scientists say golf course wetlands are the future for breeding threatened native fish

image.altText: A drone shot of Whyalla, South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australian police say a woman has died after a dog attack at Whyalla in South Australia's upper Spencer Gulf region this afternoon.

title.children: Woman dies after dog attack in regional South Australia

image.altText: Netflix will have access to the storied Hollywood studio's vast catalogue of films and TV shows.

props.synopsis: A major deal between Netflix and Warner Bros has sent shock waves through Hollywood and sparked backlash.

title.children: Why Hollywood has called the Netflix-Warner Bros merger a disaster

image.altText: Two people dressed in blue protective gear carrying out a stretcher with a body on it covered in a white sheet.

props.synopsis: Gunmen stormed a hostel in the early hours of the morning, shooting 25 people at the scene and killing at least 11 people, including three children.

title.children: At least 11 killed in South Africa hostel shooting

image.altText: a hand holding up a cassette tap

props.synopsis: For a supposedly obsolete music format, audio cassette sales seem to be set on fast forward at the moment.

title.children: Fragile, inconvenient and low quality: Why are cassettes making a comeback?

image.altText: A woman, her face obsucred, looks at a framed photograph of women and children in the desert

props.synopsis: In the 1960s, the last of the desert families were coming into contact with white people. For one woman, the moment was captured on camera.

title.children: This rare photo captures the 'first contact' between desert families and white Australia

image.altText: A female's hands operate a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Australia's social media age ban is one of the most significant attempts to rebalance the asymmetric power relationship between government and tech.

title.children: Parents could grant Labor the grace the opposition won't on social media ban

image.altText: Pro-choice protesters dressed as handmaidens outside the US Capitol

props.synopsis: In the wake of widespread abortion bans, US prosecutors launch hundreds of cases charging people with crimes related to their pregnancy, miscarriage, stillbirth or birth.

title.children: 'This was a wanted pregnancy': The mothers facing prosecution in Trump's America

image.altText: A photo of Adam Watts in police uniform smiling alongside a  photo of a NSW Police logo.

props.synopsis: A former NSW Police officer with post-traumatic stress disorder had his mental health incorrectly challenged by a doctor who never consulted or examined him during a year-long battle with the force's insurer.

title.children: Officer's mental health questioned by insurance doctor he'd never met

image.altText: A Latina woman with long brown hair and a guide dog walking across a crowded crossing

props.synopsis: Living with vision impairment throws up many challenges. Being Deaf on top of that requires you to go to even greater lengths just to fit in with the modern world. This is how one Deafblind woman does it.

title.children: Jael is Deaf and blind. Here's how she goes about her day

image.altText: New prep-aged children sit on floor in circle in prep classroom playing barrel of monkeys game at Spring Mountain State School.

props.synopsis: Parents had the opportunity to pore over NAPLAN results for their children's school this week, but interpreting the data may not have been clear at first glance.

title.children: Why you may want to take a closer look at a school's NAPLAN results

image.altText: Thailand’s Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul

props.synopsis: Accused of incompetence and apathy in the aftermath of natural disasters, governments across Asia are facing increasing backlash as the impact of global warming intensifies.

title.children: A new storm is brewing in South-East Asia. This time it's in the halls of power

image.altText: A display monitor on the handlebars of an e-bike

props.synopsis: An e-bike will be top of their Christmas wish list this year, prompting a warning for parents to know the rules.

title.children: A Christmas warning for parents thinking of buying an e-bike

image.altText: A large amount of fire can be seen blasting from the end of a piece of Ukrainian artillery

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin this week claimed Moscow's biggest battlefield gain in close to two years: the Ukrainian city of Pokrovsk. Some experts don't believe him.

title.children: Why the small city of Pokrovsk means so much to Vladimir Putin

image.altText: Packages of seized cocaine wrapped up and displayed at an AFP press conference.

props.synopsis: The alleged use of an international livestock ship to smuggle drugs into Western Australia last month prompted a media storm, but one expert says it is just one among a "dizzying variety" of methods criminals are trying.

title.children: 'Motherships', corpses and 'comical' failures as drug smugglers try it all

image.altText: Fence visible through trees at Casuarina Prison

props.synopsis: The coroner investigating WA’s first recorded death in youth detention is expected to hand down wide-ranging findings and recommendations following the death of 16-year-old Cleveland Dodd in 2022. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Wide-ranging findings set to be handed down on death of 16yo in youth detention

image.altText: Afghans prepare the body of a man killed during an overnight exchange of fire between Afghan and Pakistani forces

props.synopsis: Each side has blamed the other for triggering the clash in violation of a tenuous two-month ceasefire, with the clashes lasting until dawn Saturday.

title.children: Overnight fire exchange at Afghan-Pakistan border kills five civilians and wounds eight

image.altText: A picture of the golden FIFA World Cup trophy on a pedestal at a reception ahead of the World Cup draw.

props.synopsis: Australia's North American west coast adventure at the World Cup is confirmed, with matches in Vancouver, Seattle and Santa Clara in California.

title.children: Socceroos set for wild west North American adventure at World Cup 2026

image.altText: The top three F1 drivers in qualifying stand on the podium, with (left to right) Lando Norris, Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri.

props.synopsis: Aussie Oscar Piastri's hopes of the world F1 crown slump after title rivals Max Verstappen and Lando Norris finish ahead of him in Abu Dhabi GP qualifying.

title.children: 'I've got a chance': Piastri won't rule out F1 boilover despite tough qualifying
